Posts.Content: Lovely walk in sunshine along mudeford quay.  Smell of seaweed and isle of Wight in the distance.  Very good for the soul (,came home and braved the shave,) Hugs to all Dogspire
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi happy bird I was walking down on mudeford quay on gloriou sunshine last week. Yes we do live in a lovely part of the world ,Hugs Dogspire
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi I go walking first thing for about ,,2.5 miles.  Doesn't make up for my beloved swimming but one of the few ways I can still kick cancers *** This morning my husband was scouring the streets for me as evidently I had taken a long time. Totally deflated.  Cancer is in my hipbone for goodness sake and I'm not running a race. Back to it again tomorrow.  Suppose he cares at least but would be nice if he would give me a bit of space too. Love and hugs .  Sorry don't mean to whinge Dogspire
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi ronstar Lovely and sunny??? Wherever are you??? Rainy and cold in the dismal southwest. Love and hugs Dogspire Xxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi what Happened What a very kind hearted good person you are to try so hard to save a fox when you are not well yourself. I admire you. Love and hugs Dogspire Xxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Happy birthday Judith Love and hugs Dogspire Xxx
Posts.Title: Uplifting things

Posts.Content: Hi Suzy I did change my oncologist because the initial one left and was replaced by someone who seemed less experienced.however,as I was hospitalised after last chemo,I ended up back with the inexperienced chap. You just need to ask your gpnto refer you to your consultant of choice and may have to be insistent. Good luck Love and hugs Dogspire
Posts.Title: Has anyone changed oncologist mid treatment?
